books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.desc: A classic novel depicting the decadence and disillusionment of the American Dream in the Jazz Age.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.desc: A powerful story about racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South during the 1930s.

books.author: George Orwell
books.desc: A dystopian novel portraying a totalitarian regime and the struggle for individual freedom.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.desc: A classic romance novel set in 19th-century England, exploring themes of love, class, and societal expectations.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.desc: A coming-of-age story narrated by a teenage boy, questioning societal norms and the loss of innocence.

books.title: To the Lighthouse
books.author: Virginia Woolf
books.desc: An experimental novel exploring the complexities of human relationships and the passage of time.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.desc: A fantasy adventure novel following Bilbo Baggins' quest to reclaim a treasure from a dragon.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.desc: An epic tale of obsession and revenge, centered around Captain Ahab's pursuit of the white whale.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.desc: A high fantasy trilogy chronicling the journey of Frodo Baggins to destroy the One Ring.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.desc: A dystopian novel presenting a futuristic society controlled by technology and conformity.

books.title: Jane Eyre

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.desc: An ancient Greek epic poem depicting the journey of Odysseus after the fall of Troy.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.desc: A philosophical novel about a young shepherd's quest for his personal legend and the meaning of life.

books.title: The Scarlet Letter
books.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
books.desc: A story set in Puritan New England, exploring themes of sin, guilt, and redemption.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.desc: A psychological novel delving into the mind of a former student who commits a heinous crime.
